required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Phase 4 Open Label Study Of Indocyanine Green Video Angiography (ICG-VA) And Comparative Utility Of Glow800 And FL800 Intraoperative ICG-VA Tools For Intracranial Lesions

brief_summary.textblock: This is a study looking at a new way to evaluate vascular problems or tumors in brain surgery patients using a standard & approved intravenous dye and augmented reality.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a study investigating a new technique with an approved medication (ICG or indocyanine green) and using that and a near infrared mode on a standard operating room microscope to see the information provided for vascular or neoplastic (tumor related) neurosurgical problems. The technique uses the data from the microscope and using ICG with augmented reality overlaying the data into the microscope view (this is the new process). The technique is called GLOW800.

primary_outcome.description: Surgeon assessment of Glow800 compared to ICG-VA in usefulness

secondary_outcome.description: Surgeon assessment of Glow800 vs ICG-VA in identifying vascular structures (useful, somewhat useful, not useful)
Surgeon assessment of whether there is additional time (no additional time, <15 minutes additional time, <30 minutes additional time, >30 minutes additional time)
Surgeon assessment as to whether there is additional cost at surgery

arm_group.description: The treatment group will consist of patients who require a medically necessary craniotomy. If an investigator deems that it will be useful to see blood vessels better with indocyanine green (ICG) videoangiography (VA), patients may be consented for the use if ICG VA using augmented reality (GLOW800). This will not add additional time or risk to their surgery

intervention.description: The treatment group will consist of patients who require a medically necessary craniotomy. If an investigator deems that it will be useful to see blood vessels better with indocyanine green (ICG) videoangiography (VA), patients may be consented for the use if ICG VA using augmented reality (GLOW800). This will not add additional time or risk to their surgery
This is a standard medication which can be given IV during a surgery to better visualize blood vessels under the microscope

study_pop.textblock: adult patients with a brain lesion requiring surgery and for whom ICG videoangiography would be used

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients with a brain lesion requiring surgery and for whom ICG videoangiography would be used
Exclusion Criteria:
- allergy to ICG (indocyanine green)
